channel.title: VirtualBox high CPU usage
channel.description: I was seeing high CPU usage on a Whonix VM and the reason turned out to be enabling "Drag and Drop" by mistake. Even though this feature doesn't seem to work with Whonix, dragging some desktop icons even just inside the VM while this feature is turned on causes continuous high CPU usage afterwards with /usr/bin/VBoxClient being the culprit

item.title: VirtualBox high CPU usage
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
I doubt it makes any difference in a plain Debian VM? Looks like a VirtualBox bug to me.

You could try your luck on the VirtualBox bug tracker.

https://www.virtualbox.org/wiki/Bugtracker

Read full topic

item.title: VirtualBox high CPU usage
item.dc:creator: anonymous1
item.description:
I was seeing high CPU usage on a Whonix VM and the reason turned out to be enabling “Drag and Drop” by mistake. Even though this feature doesn’t seem to work with Whonix, dragging some desktop icons even just inside the VM while this feature is turned on causes continuous high CPU usage afterwards with /usr/bin/VBoxClient being the culprit

Read full topic
